ratings.comment: This guy is absolutely one of my favorite professors. He teachers you in a way for you to retain the information. His lectures are interesting, and I was actually somewhat excited to go to history class. Exams aren't that bad, either. He's a prof you can relate to. Prof D's the man!

Sean was a good teacher and I learned a lot from his class.  A lot of content included are topics that arent usually included in a typical history class that really made it interesting.  Sean was really fair and pretty clear in what he expected from students.
he's a real guy.. super relatable but obviously crazy intelligent.

Dinces was a pretty cool professor overall. He was very passionate about the course and made the class interesting. His tests and papers were very clear and appropriate too. However, it was sometimes hard to pay attention to him during lecture because he talks a lot rather than putting the material on power points.

He makes you fall in love with history.  He knows his stuff and it's so interesting to hear him speak and learn from him.  Two midterms, one paper, and a final.  I would highly recommend this class to anyone and I would take it again if I could! I always enjoyed going to history class.

he would speed through the powerpoints but all you have to do is copy those down. he gives you 30 terms to study and then chooses 8 at random for the test and you must write about the importance of each. made it a lot easier to study. he is an awesome professor and really gets you into it. i only read for the paper due at the end.

HIs lectures are substantive, fast-paced, critical, humorous; The lecture slides online are helpful; above average quantity of homework but within manageable, acceptable boundary; below average difficulty of mid and final; thought-provoking interactions with students during class time; young, upbeat and energetic; great instructor, great friend.

I really liked Prof. D. He is young and very relatable. I hate history and I thought his lectures were interesting. Tests are all memorization of terms and details. If you read and study you will be fine. One paper that wasn't bad if you were actively involved in the class throughout the semester.

Very young and relatable professor. His lectures are usually pretty interesting for a history class. Attend the lectures and scan the required texts for anything important and your grade shouldnt be an issue.
He gives great lectures if you find history interesting. They show themes relative to what you are supposed to be reading in the books assigned. If you read and go to lecture, you will be fine.
Professor Dinces seems like he cares about the students as individuals.  He takes the time to learn names.  He only required one paper which was only 3 pages long.
Lectures are really clear and factual, but he puts so much stuff in the power point slides and his lecture that you don't need to know that his lectures get long and boring.

Took his sports history seminar.  He was a very helpful and down-to-earth adviser.  Don't expect to learn a lot about sports history in general.  You will learn a lot about your topic.  Most assignments, other than the 25 page paper are graded on completion.  Decent amount of reading as well.

Very up and down class. Some topics were more interesting than others. His lecturing got better later on. He will be a very good prof, just inexperienced now. Warned us at the start that this would not be a weekly sportcenter fix and he was right. I was glad he treated it as a serious history class. Non history majors may be disappointed.

Overall a pretty good class. The topics are interesting, and lecture slides are all available online.  attendance not mandatory but he gives out pop quizzes (lowest one dropped) throughout the semester.  TA determines entirety of Grade, and grades your exams.  Exams are pretty straightforward (explaining significance of key topics from class).

Don't understand complaints about not being able to use laptop. All  slides are online taking notes is only minimally necessary. Lots of readings but you can get away with not doing them. Tests are easy & straight forward. Does a VERY good job explaining the impact and importance of what seems like an inconsequential topic. very clear  lectures.

Treats you like a high schooler, no laptops allowed and threatens to call people out if they're using cell phones during lecture. He moves fast so its hard to write everything down. Its a fun topic and he's willing to help and wants you to learn, but not being able to use my computer to keep up with him hurts my grade.
